page.title: 05FARMING IN HARVEL
page.content: During the past 30 years this area has changed from dairying to mainly arable with some sheep. Only two herds remain, one pedigree beef and one dairy. E.E.C. subsidies have changed the springtime green to the brilliant yellow of oil-seed rape and many hedges have disappeared to facilitate the use of ever bigger machines.The numerous roadside hedges are well maintained and a haven for wildlife. Mechanisation has increased the output by 300% over 30 years but this has meant fewer farm workers employed. This has caused the sale of numerous farmhouses and cottages and the amalgamation of local farms. The farms locally are between 70 and 180 acres now, mostly about 120 acres. One farm employed 14 men 35 years ago - now it will be hard put to employ the second son.
